citation.article-title: Reclassification of Cytophaga aprica (Lewin 1969) Reichenbach 1989 in Flammeovirga gen. nov., as Flammeovirga aprica comb. nov. and of Cytophaga diffluens (ex Stanier 1949; emend Lewin 1969) Reichenbach 1989 in Persicobacter gen. nov., as Persicobacter diffluens comb. nov.

p.s: Persicobacter (Per.si.co.bac'ter. Gr. neut. n. persikon, peach; M.L. masc. n. bacter, rod; L. masc. n. Persicobacter, peach rod, because the organism is a peach-colored rod)
Cells are slender flexible rods that are 0.5 μm wide and 4 to 30 μm long.
Cell mass is pink to orange.
Strict aerobes with a respiratory type of metabolism.
All strains of the type species decompose alginate, agar, gelatin, and starch.
The major isoprenoid quinone is MK-7.
The G+C content of the DNA is 40 to 42 mol%.
The type species of the genus is Persicobacter diffluens comb. nov.
The description of P. diffluens is the same as that given by Reichenbach (20).
